p: Most species threatened with extinction face multiple, often interacting, threats [ 1, 2]. For many of these species, the loss or fragmentation of habitat is the leading threat, and conversion to agriculture is the most common reason for habitat loss [ 1, 3]. However, without significant, successful, and swift efforts to reduce greenhouse-gas emissions, climate change may soon rival land-use change as the leading threat to many species and ecological systems [ 3].
